title: Partial texture updates will update the sampler in `egui_glow` but not `egui_wgpu`
body:
<!--
First look if there is already a similar bug report. If there is, upvote the issue with ðŸ‘

Please also check if the bug is still present in latest master! Do so by adding the following lines to your Cargo.toml:


[patch.crates-io]
egui = { git = "https://github.com/emilk/egui", branch = "master" }
# if you're using eframe:
eframe = { git = "https://github.com/emilk/egui", branch = "master" }
-->

**Describe the bug**

When using `set_partial` to update a texture, you provide a `TextureOptions` as the third argument. In the `egui_glow` backend, these options are applied to the texture. However, in `egui_wgpu`, they are ignored entirely, and are only updated when you use `set` to *fully* replace the texture.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Call `ctx.load_texture` with a new `ColorImage` and some `TextureOptions`
2. Call `set_partial` on the returned `TextureHandle` with some different `TextureOptions` (e.g. switch from linear to nearest-neighbor interpolation)
3. Render the texture via an `Image` widget
4. If you're using the `glow` backend, it'll appear using the new `TextureOptions` passed via `set_partial`. If you're using the `wgpu` backend, it'll appear using the original `TextureOptions` passed via `load_texture`.

**Expected behavior**
Calling `set_partial` should update the `TextureOptions` in both cases. Alternatively, it could be separated into different functions for updating the texture data and the texture options.
